captions.text:
INTRO-----
HI GUYS I’M CATIE WAYNE AND THIS IS ANIMALIST

NEWS.
DID YOU KNOW THAT BLACK PANTHERS AREN’T

A REAL SPECIES?!
THEY’RE ACTUALLY MISIDENTIFIED MELANISTIC

LEOPARDS, JAGUARS, AND OTHER BIG CATS.
MELANISM IS THE OPPOSITE CONDITION OF ALBINISM

WHICH MAKES THE ANIMAL COMPLETELY BLACK.
SO OUR INTERN, AMBER, HAS BEEN TRYING REALLY

HARD TO FIGURE OUT WHY PEOPLE STARTED CALLING
THESE CATS BLACK PANTHERS AND- YOU KNOW WHAT…

LET’S JUST BRING HER OUT HERE.
HEY AMBER!

AMBER:
HEY CATIE I HAVE BEEN SEARCHING EVERYWHERE

TO FIGURE THIS OUT!
I’VE CONTACTED TONS OF UNIVERSITIES, ZOOS,
RESCUE GROUPS, EVERYTHING I CAN THINK OF

CATIE:
AND?

AMBER:
AND HERE’S YOUR ANSWER…
I HAVE NO FREAKING IDEA HOW IT ALL STARTED.

CATIE:
WAIT WHAT? WE DON’T PAY YOU TO COME UP EMPTY
HANDED.

AMBER:
OKAY CALM DOWN… I HAVE A THEORY…

CATIE:
GO ON…

AMBER:
ACCORDING TO THE NICE PEOPLE I SPOKE TO AT

WILD ANIMAL SANCTUARY, THE WORD “PANTHER”
MEANS CAT.

CATIE:
WHICH IS WHY MOST FELINES HAVE THE WORD “PANTHERA”

IN THEIR GENUS NAME LIKE “PANTHERA LEO”
AND “PANTHERA PARDUS”!

AMBER:
I THINK PANTHERA UN-CIA IS MY FAVORITE. THAT’S

A SNOW LEOPARD FOR ALL YA’LL NON SCIENTIFIC
FOLK.

CATIE:
OKAY SO ANYWAYS WHAT YOU’RE BASICALLY SAYING

IS THAT “PANTHER” DOESN’T REFER TO ANY
SPECIFIC CAT?

AMBER:
THAT’S EXACTLY WHAT I’M SAYING. SO IF

PEOPLE SAW A BIG BLACK CAT AND WEREN’T EXACTLY
SURE IF IT WAS A LEOPARD OR A JAGUAR, THE

EASIEST THING TO SAY WOULD BE “OH MY GOD
LOOK AT THAT BLACK PANTHER!”

CATIE:
BUT-BUT WHAT ABOUT BAGHEERA THE BLACK PANTHER

FROM THE JUNGLE BOOK? ARE YOU SAYING THAT
MY CHILDHOOD WAS A LIE?

AMBER:
I’M SORRY, BUT BAGHEERA WAS PROBABLY ACTUALLY

A MELANISTIC LEOPARD. UNFORTUNATELY, THERE’S
ALSO NO SUCH THING AS A PINK PANTHER.

CATIE:
AMBER. YOU MAY LEAVE.

AMBER:
BUT I WAS JUST-

CATIE:
AMBER. YOU MAY LEAVE. WELL IF YOU GUYS THINK

YOU HAVE A BETTER IDEA LET US KNOW IN THE
COMMENTS DOWN BELOW!

comments.author: sophia crowe

comments.text:
Okay, so there are numerous things wrong with you're statement up there. 
I'm not saying you are lying, but let's just clear a few things up.

Leopards don't live in Virginia. They aren't native to North or South 
America, but in fact make their home in Africa and South Asia. For a 
moment, let's just say you meant meant "mountain lion" instead, as they are 
the only big cats that live around Virginia. Mountain lions are extremely 
endangered in the eastern and central U.S. so hunting them is illegal. 
Secondly, mountain lions usually avoid humans. If provoked, they with most 
likely run off, unless you are too close to a female mountain lion's 
cubs. This fact disproves you even coming in contacts with such a cat, let 
alone it trying to "eat you".

comments.text:
Panther exist but is a genus of the felid subfamily named Pantherinae. SO 
Panther denominated a variety of large cats such tigers, lions, jaguars, 
leopards and snow leopards, all this cats are panthers acording with the 
clasification. The tiger is Panthera tigris, snow leopard is Panthera 
uncia, the jaguar is Panthera  onca etc.

comments.text:
Best guess. "Panther" is one of the many names used for the mountain lion. 
The mountain lion's range overlaps that of the jaguar. Since black jaguar's 
markings are hard to see, they may have been mistaken for "black" mountain 
lions (which also don't exist).﻿

comments.author: Angelo Gonzalodo

comments.text:
Panther does not mean cat. It means big cat, as in the Panthera genus, 
which includes lions, tigers, jaguars and the many varieties of leopards. 
Smaller cat species (the largest being cougars and cheetahs) do not fall 
into Panthera, and are therefore not technically 'panthers' - even though 
cougars in Florida are called 'Florida Panthers'.﻿
